meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by disomy.
meanings.sent1: The disomic cells showed a balanced genetic makeup.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the disomic traits in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The disomic twins always dressed alike, confusing everyone around them.
meanings.sent4: Her disomic approach to problem-solving ensured a harmonious outcome.
meanings.sent5: The disomic nature of the painting created a sense of symmetry and balance.

meanings.definition: Having two homologous chromosomes in a cell.
meanings.sent1: The disomic organisms displayed genetic diversity.
meanings.sent2: The disomic pair of chromosomes replicated perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The disomic siblings shared a special bond due to their genetic similarity.
meanings.sent4: The disomic structure of the DNA was crucial for cell division.
meanings.sent5: The disomic cells multiplied rapidly, ensuring a healthy growth process.
